contentrichtext.text: '''Zen Guerrilla''' was a rock band originally from Newark, Delaware and currently from [[San Francisco, California]]. Musically, the band evolved over their career. Their early sound was characterized by [[psychedelic]] elements, such as delayed [[guitar]]s and noise washes. Their unique sound gained a growing local following (winning several Philly music awards), however, did not increase marketability. Later, Zen Guerrilla fused [[blues (music)|blues]], [[Rock music|rock]] and [[gospel (music)|gospel]] to create a sound which could be likened to bands such as the [[Jon Spencer|Jon Spencer Blues Explosion]]. ==History== Zen Guerrilla formed in [[Newark, Delaware]] in the late 80s. Band members Andy Duvall (drums), Marcus Durant (vocals/harmonica), Carl Horne (bass), and Rich Millman (guitar) came together from local bands Marcus Hook, The Gollywogs, Stone Groove and No Comment. The band released their self-titled CD on [[Philadelphia]]-based [[Compulsiv Records]] in 1992 and Recorded at the world famous Third Story Recording Studio in Walnut Hill. Soon after, Zen Guerrilla moved to [[Philadelphia]] and were regular performers around the city at clubs such as the Kyber Pass Pub. Around this time the band began a heavy touring schedule, which would have them cross the country multiple times through the end of the decade. Zen Guerrilla relocated to [[San Francisco]] in 1994. Their constant touring increased their exposure, and, combined with their explosive live show, helped to release albums first with [[Alternative Tentacles]] and later [[Subpop|Sub Pop]], which is known for being the original record company of [[Nirvana (band)|Nirvana]]. The band's version of the song "Empty Heart" was featured in the 2000 PlayStation game ''[[Grind Session]]''. The band dissolved sometime around 2003. ==Discography== ===Albums=== *''Zen Guerrilla'' - [[Compulsiv Records|Compulsiv]] 1992 *''Invisible "Liftee" Pad / Gap-Tooth Clown'' - [[Alternative Tentacles]] 1997 *''Positronic Raygun'' - [[Alternative Tentacles]] 1998 *''Trance States in Tongues'' - [[Subpop|Sub Pop]] 1999 *''Shadows on the Sun'' - [[Subpop|Sub Pop]] 2001 *''Heavy Mellow'' - Flapping Jet 2002 (LP picture disc) ===EPs=== *''Creature Double Feature'' - Insect 1995 *''Invisible "Liftee" Pad'' - Insect 1996 *''Gap-Tooth Clown'' - Insect 1997 *''Plasmic Tears and the Invisible City'' - Insect 2002 ===Singles=== *''Pull b/w Nile Song'' - Union Hall 1993 *''Crow b/w Unusual'' - Union Hall 1994 *''Trouble Shake b/w Change Gonna Come'' - [[Alternative Tentacles]] 1997 *''Ghetto City Version b/w Hungry Wolf'' - [[Epitaph Records|Epitaph]] 1999 *''Mama's Little Rocket'' - Allied Recordings 2000 *''Dirty Mile b/w Ham and Eggs'' - [[Estrus Records|Estrus]] 2000 *''Pocketful of String b/w Wigglin' Room'' - Fanboy 2000 *''The Seeker b/w Half Step'' - [[Subpop|Sub Pop]] 2000 *''Mob Rules b/w The Trooper'' - Safety Pin 2001 ==External links== * [http://www.carltonmeltonmusic.com/] Andy Duvall's new band 'Carlton Melton' * [http://www.myspace.com/carlhorneexperiment The Carl Horne Experiment] solo act of bassist. * [http://www.myspace.com/browntownwest Browntown West] 3/4 of band doing cover songs with Christa DiBiase on vocals. {{DEFAULTSORT:Zen Guerrilla}} [[Category:Musical groups from San Francisco, California]] {{US-rock-band-stub}}
